intro: Syndesmanthus fasciculatus, commonly known as the clustered goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, cylindrical clusters of small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in dry, open habitats and has silver-gray foliage that reflects sunlight. Syndesmanthus fasciculatus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
